div1.p: In the Circuit Court of the United States, Ninth Judicial Circuit, District of Washington Northern Division.
In the Matter of the application of George Webster, for A Writ of Habeas Corpus.
P E T I T I O N
FILED IN THE U. S. Circuit Court, DIST. OF WASHINGTON. JUL 25 1899 A. REEVES AYRES, Clerk R. M. Hapkins
James Hamilton Lewis Del Cary Smith, and James E. Fenton, Attorneys for petitioner.
United States Circuit Court for the District of Washington. In the matter application of George Webster for Writ of Habeas Corpus vs.
No. Appearance
To the Clerk of the above Entitled Court: You will please enter our appearance as attorneys for Petitioner in the above entitled cause James Hamilton Lewis J. E. Fenton Del Cary Smith
NOTICE- Attorneys will please endorse their own Filings. Rule 47.
Jt GoB 6-160.
United States Circuit Court District of Washington.
In. R. application of George Webster for Writ vs. Habeas Corpus
Appearance.
Filed July 25 1899 A Reeves Ayres Clerk. By RM Hapkins Deputy Clerk. For
UNITED STATES CIRCUIT COURT FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON.
In the Matter of the Application of George Webster for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
To the Clerk of the above entitled Court: You will please prepare 3 certified copies of order denying and refusing to grant Writ and allowing the appeal herein.
Prepare three (3) copies of the original citation in the above entitled cause.
James Hamtilon Lewis James E. Fenton Del Cary Smith Attorneys for Petitioner.
Tx No. 781
IN THE Circuit COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON
In the Application of Geo Webster for vs. Writ of Habeas Corpus
Praecpie
Filed July 25 1899 A. Reeves Ayres Clerk By RM Hapkins Deputy
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the application of George Webster, for A Writ of Habeas Corpus.
NOTICE.
To R. D. Speck, Sheriff of Spokane County, State of Washington.
You will please take notice hereby that George Webster now in your custody duly petitioned the United States Circuit Court for Writ of Habeas Corpus, seeking relief thereupon and
Whereas, the said writ and relief was denied, and whereas said petitioner duly moved for a writ of appeal and 6r the trans- fer ofhis whole cause to the Supreme Court of the United States, and,

Whereas, t he said cause came on for argument as to the granting of the said appeal and the transfer of the whole cause to the appellate court, and was heard upon 25th day of July 1899 by the Honorable C. H. Hanford, Circuit Judge, and

Whereas, after hearing said application order of appeal was duly granted and the said cause was so ordered transferred to the Supreme Court of the United States and a full copy of the aforesaid proceedings and the order allowing said appeal, being duly certified is hereunto annexed for your information and advice, and

Section 766. "Pending the proceedings of appeal in the cases mentioned in the three preceeding sections, and until final judgment therein, and after final judgment of discharge, any proceeding against the person so imprisoned or confined or restrained of his liberty, in any state court, or by or under the authority of any
State, for any matter so heard and determined, or in the process of be- ing heard and determined, under such writ of Habeas Corpus, shall be deemed null and void," and

Whereas, the Supreme Court of the United States in Re Jugiro 140 United States 295, construing the said section defined the same to mean, "in cases where the appellant was held in custody under the authority of the State court, or by authority of a state, to stay the hands of sid court or state, while the question as to whether his detention was in violation of the Constitution, laws or treaties of the United States was being examined by the courts of the United States, having jurisdiction in the premises; which said decision is more fully referred to in the case of In re M'Kane 01 Fed. 205, where in was held to mean that until final decision in the Supreme Court of the United States no disturbance of the condi- tion of the person as he was at the time of the denying of the writ can in any wise he had,

THEREFORE, you are hereby notified that you are to hold poss- ession or custody of the said Petitioner George Webster, now in your keeping at Spokane, in the County of Spokane, State of Wash- ington, in such manner as to your discretion shall seem meet and proper in no wise assuming for any cause to execute any sentence of death whatsoever upon the said petitioner George Webster, and you will be duly notified of any further proceeding in the premises.
You wll please govern yourself accordingly. James Hamilton Lewis James E. Fenton Del Cary Smith Attorneys for petitioner.
United States of America ) District of Washington, )ss County of Whitman. )
Copy ofthe within notice received and service of the same is here by acknowledged thi s day of July, 1899.
Sheriff of Spokane County State of Washington.
Prosecuting attorney for Spokane County, State of Washington.
No 781 Tx In Cicruit Court of the U.S. for the District of Washington In .R. application for Writ of Habeas Corpus George Webster Notice
FILED IN THE U. S. CIRCUIT COURT DIST. OF WASHINGTON. JUL251899 A. REEVES AYRES, Clerk. R M Hapkins Dep.
UNITED STATES CIRCUIT COURT FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON.
In the Matter of the Application of George Webster for a Writ of Habeas Corpus. R. D. Speck, Sheriff of Spokane County, Washington, etc.
To the Clerk of the above entitled Court:

You will please issue citation returnable pursuant to the rules in such cases, also prepare appeal and make transcript on appeal to the Supreme Court of the United States to include Pe- tition for Habeas Corpus Writ, Order denying the issuance of Writ and allowing the appeal, Notice of appeal to the Supreme Court and notice to the Sheriff and duly vertify the same within the time and manner prescribed by law.
James Hamilton Lewis James E. Fenton Del Cary Smith Attorneys for Patitioner
Tx No. 781
IN THE Circuit COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON
In re application of Geo Webster for vs. Writ of Habeas Corpus Praecipe Filed July 25 1899 A. Reeves Ayres Clerk By RM Hapkins Deputy
